unnormalised: **Question: What are some yoga practices that have genuinely improved your overall well-being?**
normalised: **Question: What are some yoga practices that have genuinely improved your overall well-being?**

unnormalised: Okay, so I’m not claiming to be a yoga guru or anything, but I’ve definitely seen a positive shift in my life since I started incorporating certain practices into my daily routine. It all started when my doctor recommended it for some persistent back pain I was having after all that WFH during the pandemic.
normalised: Okay, so I am not claiming to be a yoga guru or anything, but I have definitely seen a positive shift in my life since I started incorporating certain practices into my daily routine. It all started when my doctor recommended it for some persistent back pain I was having after all that W F H during the pandemic.

unnormalised: Initially, I thought it would be all about pretzel-like poses that I could never achieve. I even joked about it being like something out of a dramatic Bollywood film with dramatic background music and impossible feats! But I was so wrong.
normalised: Initially, I thought it would be all about pretzel-like poses that I could never achieve. I even joked about it being like something out of a dramatic Bollywood film with dramatic background music and impossible feats! But I was so wrong.

unnormalised: For me, the most impactful practices have been simple breathing exercises (Pranayama). Just 10 minutes of Anulom Vilom in the morning really helps clear my head before the chaos of the day begins. Then there's Surya Namaskar – a set of 12 poses that I try to do at least 3 times a week. It’s surprisingly energizing.
normalised: For me, the most impactful practices have been simple breathing exercises (Pranayama). Just ten minutes of Anulom Vilom in the morning really helps clear my head before the chaos of the day begins. Then there is Surya Namaskar – a set of twelve poses that I try to do at least three times a week. It is surprisingly energizing.

unnormalised: Beyond the physical benefits, I’ve noticed a huge improvement in my mental clarity and focus. I live in Delhi, so the daily hustle and bustle can get really overwhelming. But even a short meditation session after yoga helps me stay grounded and centered. My aunt in Rishikesh swears by the teachings of the Parmarth Niketan Ashram and has encouraged me to learn more about Patanjali’s Yoga Sutras. I'm slowly working on it!

unnormalised: It's been a journey, but I’m really grateful for the positive changes yoga has brought to my life. Definitely worth exploring if you're looking for ways to improve your overall well-being.
